answers.answer: If you’re not cirrhotic, there’s no specific diet for HCV patients; your liver will continue to synthesize and metabolize ordinary food. We’ll all benefit from a healthy diet, however; HCV infected or not.Hep C patients often have iron storage problems; it might be advisable to avoid additional iron supplements, unless told otherwise by your doctor. Watch for increases in blood glucose; some of us might additionally be prone to developing type 2 diabetes. Discuss all this with your doctor,Bill

question: Since I found out that I have hep c, I have been eating and drinking lots of protien/carbs. Which is normally good for underweight people, but is it good for people with Hepatitis C?
title: Is a high protien/carbohydrate diet good for people with hepatitis c?
